item.title: Dumped rubbish bags spilling over pavement, 2nd July
item.description:
More rubbish has been dumped on the corner of Daubeney Road and Marsh Hill. Is it possible for this to be collected? Lots of kids pass this corner on the way to and from school.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Marsh Hill, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Tree outside property, 2nd July
item.description:
Branches need cutting back asap, this tree sheds all over the payment and our cars/driveways, the pathway is covered in berries and leaves and pavement never regularly swept up. this tree needs cutting back to helpp reduce this awful constant shedding and the pavement/road desperately needs sweeping to clear it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brixham Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive dog poo on pavement., 2nd July
item.description:
Dog poo is dangerous for children. This has been left by an inconsiderate and irresponsible dog owner.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Avenue, Plaistow, London

item.title: Unauthorised parking suspension and blocked pavement, 2nd July
item.description:
Builders at 11 Palace Court have been blocking off 4-5 parking spaces 24hrs a day despite their permission for only two. They are also preventing pedestrian traffic when transporting materials across the pavement which is forcing pedestrians into the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Palace Court, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter building and not cleared for weeks, 2nd July
item.description:
Winder road looks like rubbish dump and has not been swept for weeks. Why not? The council webiste says it is cleared once a day, which is patently untrue. Other streets in the area are cleaned regularly but not Winder Road. Why?!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, Winders Road, Battersea, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Moundfield Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Graffiti, 2nd July
item.description:
There is new graffiti from here all the way down the thames path towards the cutty sark. This is very close to the unesco world heritage site as well in Greenwich. It is becoming a nuisance as new graffiti is appearing down the Thames path constantly. The bins are overflowing with rubbish for days

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manilla Walk, East Greenwich, London
